logentry.author: rodda

logentry.author: dymo
logentry.msg: Fix tab activation bug after closing another tabs without switching to them (for example clicking on another tab's close button). We should remove the widget from container's stack before removing it from the tabbar, tabbar activates new widget by its index, and if the old one is still in stack, then indices are off by one. For me this also fixes the crash in ctrl-tab document switcher (which probably got activation signal of the view which was already deleted). BUG:204383

logentry.author: nsams
logentry.msg: Update locals only once. (fixes crash)

logentry.author: scripty
logentry.msg: SVN_SILENT made messages (.desktop file)

logentry.author: dymo
logentry.msg:
Do not leave empty toplevel widgets after closing all open files with "Close All": - it was the left corner workingset indicator widget which was reparented to 0 and stayed visible - the current fix is to hide it before reparenting and show right after adding to the corner - this fix is of course bad, but it's not worse than the code which manages this widget (in general, workingsets do not properly integrate into the UI)
BUG:198251

logentry.author: apaku
logentry.msg: Oops, I mean to make this a KLineEdit, not KTextEdit.

logentry.author: apaku
logentry.msg: Make the destination a plain lineedit, having a url-requester there causes too much confusion.

logentry.author: apaku
logentry.msg:
Disable the sourceformatter as its not possible to fix this up without major time investment.
I've looked a bit at the code today and all I can say is wow, this is broken. It stores pointers to plugins, doesn't update them as needed assumes everywhere that things will be alright (i.e. no empty-checks, no null-pointer-checks). This is not possible to fix easily without changing major parts of the code. At this point in the release such a major restructuring is not going to happen, additionally this codebase is basically unmaintained ever since it was imported into svn.
So we'll have to live without it for 4.0

logentry.author: apaku
logentry.msg: These messages have no meaning to endusers and they can't do anything about the warnings. Hence they should be debug messages.

logentry.author: apaku
logentry.msg: Increase version number for beta7

logentry.author: apol
logentry.msg:
When the debugging session was closed, the model was dereferenced and the changed when the column changed signal was triggered. Added a conditional to check if the session is still alive to ask for more frames.
Just fixes a crash.

logentry.author: zwabel
logentry.msg: Significantly speed up the reference-counting for the case that there is only one reference-counted memory range, which should be 99% of the cases.

logentry.author: zwabel
logentry.msg:
- Handle the ModificationRevisionSet "needsUpdate" cache more intelligently: Don't clear the cache on every significant ModificationRevisionSet operation, instead just remove dead entries in realtime, and use the ModificationRevision timeout for the cache lifetime. - Increase the timeout to 30 seconds, so the caching really shows an effect.
This improves the speed of preprocessing/parsing in C++, and especially the speed of checking whether all top-contexts are still up to date.

logentry.author: apaku
logentry.msg: Implement validation of vcs import data. BUG:202325

logentry.author: apaku
logentry.msg: hasValidData() is needed to be able to do vcs-specific checks on the input (like valid svn urls).

logentry.msg: Make this a debug message. Its not very useful for endusers and it pollutes the output.

Make the labels do word-wrapping to avoid very long lines.
BUG: 187612

logentry.author: apaku
logentry.msg: Add Close-Others and Reload to the context menu. Additionally fixes a small issue with highlighting selected document. Patch by Olivier.jg, thanks. CCMAIL:olivier.jg@gmail.com BUG:182786

logentry.author: zwabel
logentry.msg: - Partition the diffrent TopDUContext::Features flags a bit more logically, and add some documentation - Add 2 processing-levels to TopDUContext::Features: The "Empty" level which allows only collecting meta-information about top-contexts, and the "SimplifiedVisibleDeclarationsAndContexts" level which allows collecting simplified declarations after preprocessing, but without type-lookup and all the complex stuff. This will essentially allow to optionally reduce the global processing to a ctags-like level. - Move some more information statically into ParsingEnvironmentFile, and manage the 'features' that are satisfied by top-contexts through global sets using the efficient SetRepository algorithms. This allows efficiently checking whether all top-contexts imported recursively into another one satisfy a specific set of TopDUContext::Features in ParsingEnvironmentFile::featuresSatisfied, if the TopDUContext::Recursive flag is set.

logentry.author: zwabel
logentry.msg: Restrict problem-ranges to the document. This fixes the problem that an unresolved #include directive at the end of the document highlighted the whole document with the error-underline if the directive was not terminated by a newline.

logentry.author: zwabel
logentry.msg:
Add a command-line utility called 'duchainify'. This utility allows specifying a directory, and the duchain will be built for the complete recursive content of that directory using the specific language supports. Thread-count, duchain-features, verbosity and more can be specified through the command-line.
This utility can be used to profile and debug duchain building, and as basis for possible other applications that might want to use the duchain through command-line.

logentry.author: coles
logentry.msg:
Revised the icon updates following discussion:
* Context icon did exist, called 'code-context', now using it for the context browser. * Generic quickopen icon did exist, called 'quickopen', using it for the quickopen plugin. * Using the 'new project' icon for the app wizard rather than 'new file'.
The kate/snippets plugin doesn't have an icon defined yet, will drop authors a mail to see if they've requested one.
CCMAIL: apaku@gmx.de

logentry.author: coles
logentry.msg:
Fixing/assigning icons to plugins for when they appear in the 'Configure Plugins' dialog.
First, icon references that were broken:
* Konsole - the konsole icon it was trying to use, which is actually called terminal * Find in files - was trying to use find, should be kfind
Plugins that have icons elsewhere:
* class browser - the icon it had elsewhere in kdevelop (code-class) * Quick open - the icon it had elsewhere in kdevelop (called quickopen-class)
Plugins for which the icon is IMO obvious:
* File manager - the file manager icon (i.e. that of dolphin) * CVS - the cervisia icon * execute - the system run (gear) icon
Plugins for which I think a reasonable icon choice is intuitive:
* The most recently used document switcher - the 'open recent' icon * Open with - the 'open document' icon * New app wizard - the 'new document' icon * Problem reporter - the red warning symbol (! in a circle)
Then, icons which seem okay, but I'm not totally sold on:
* document view - document (pre)view icon, given that's more or less what it does * Snippets - the 'Copy' icon * Context browser - the 'Class' icon * Subversion - the 'svn_merge' icon

add Import kind to Declaration, so we can re-use all the nice Declaration features for file includes, e.g. uses, jump to dec==file etc.

logentry.author: scripty
logentry.msg: SVN_SILENT made messages (.desktop file)

logentry.author: nsams
logentry.msg: Return variables, so values or children can be added

logentry.author: sengels
logentry.msg: cleanup a bit; use constantly m_controller after it has been set.

logentry.author: apaku
logentry.msg: Remove useless code for the projectview-loading.

logentry.author: apaku
logentry.msg: Make the projectmanagerview automatically load on startup

logentry.author: apaku
logentry.msg: Provide the same cmake variables for the libraries as are set by FindKDevPlatform, so we can more easily move around plugins. Fixes compilation of documentview.

logentry.author: apaku
logentry.msg: Remove the last remaining of Veritas

logentry.author: apaku
logentry.msg: Add the documentview plugin that is here now.

logentry.author: apaku
logentry.msg: Increase the version after the recent changes.

logentry.author: apaku
logentry.msg: No git plugin here anymore.

logentry.author: apaku
logentry.msg: Move the git plugin as it unfortunately doesn't work at all as far as I know.

logentry.author: apaku
logentry.msg: Move this plugin to the platform as its useful for other kdevplatform apps too.

logentry.author: apaku
logentry.msg: no veritas here anymore.

logentry.author: apaku
logentry.msg: Move the veritas library to playground as its been unmaintained for a while and nobody is interested in it as far as history shows.

logentry.author: apaku
logentry.msg: Remove now-useless version checks for KDE 4.2/Qt4.4

logentry.author: apaku
logentry.msg: Increase requirement to KDE 4.3

logentry.author: scripty
logentry.msg: SVN_SILENT made messages (.desktop file)

logentry.author: coles
logentry.msg: Corrected a couple of minor typos.

logentry.author: nsams
logentry.msg: Add asserts to make sure required controllers are returned correctly by the DebugSession

logentry.author: nsams
logentry.msg: Revert 1030728, DebugSession must provide a VariableController. XDebug does that now too.

logentry.author: mwolff
logentry.msg: fix lookup by language-name, since X-KDevelop-Language is defined as QString, the QStringList operator 'in' won't work in the KTrader language. makes loading language plugins on-demand via LanguageController::language() possible

logentry.author: nsams
logentry.msg: Stop debug session in cleanup method, not in destructor, as the core is gone in destructor. (as suggested by Andreas)

logentry.author: nsams
logentry.msg: Stop debug session on shutdown

logentry.author: nsams
logentry.msg: Make methods public to modify children from outside. (Needed in xdebug plugin)

logentry.author: nsams
logentry.msg: Move code that marks watches out of scope when debugger ended into platform

logentry.author: mlaurent
logentry.msg: Add missing i18n

logentry.author: scripty
logentry.msg: SVN_SILENT made messages (.desktop file)

logentry.author: apaku
logentry.msg: Properly reset the maximized widget member if a widget is removed from the layout. Fixes a crash when trying to close the maximized toolview. BUG:209550

logentry.author: nsams
logentry.msg: Don't crash when debugger doesn't provide a VariableController

logentry.author: nsams
logentry.msg: Make FrameStackModel and VariableController optional, not every debugger might implement them.

logentry.author: nsams
logentry.msg: Call function to get FrameStackModel, as it does delayed initialization and might not yet be initialized.

logentry.author: mwolff
logentry.msg: fix init order to remove compiler warning

logentry.author: mwolff
logentry.msg: make declarationKind virtual instead of static so we can do language-dependant stuff in it

logentry.author: zwabel
logentry.msg: Make the connections queued, to prevent a possible deadlock-crash BUG: 208966

logentry.author: apaku
logentry.msg: Multiple targets with the same name are not supported since CMake 2.6.0, so lets fix this (even though KDE enforces the pre-2.6 behaviour).

logentry.author: bbroeksema
logentry.msg: Implement mapping between Uses and AST nodes.

logentry.author: zwabel
logentry.msg: Remove the remaining revision management code from the editor-integrator. It used to not properly release revisions. This fixes the problem that the patch-review didn't work at all in recent revisions of kate, and fixes the problem that all highlighting from the foreground thread (patch-review, problem-reporter) completely stopped working after a document was reloaded

logentry.author: scripty
logentry.msg: SVN_SILENT made messages (.desktop file)

logentry.author: mwolff
logentry.msg: remove obsolete TODO

logentry.author: mwolff
logentry.msg: use created() and deleted() signals instead of dirty(), is lot nicer and faster, since we don't have to re-import the whole parent-dir, only add/delete what is required

logentry.author: apol
logentry.msg: Delay deletion so that we don't get stuff removed while changing documentation. Makes it possible to use actions in the documentation for navigation.

logentry.author: zwabel
logentry.msg: Unlock the smart-lock earlier. This fixes a possible deadlock.

logentry.author: nsams
logentry.msg: Partly revert r1025008, crash was solved by removing invalid nodes from the tree after lanuch type changed.

logentry.author: mueller
logentry.msg: always return something

logentry.author: apol
logentry.msg: Use the proper signal to search in the documentation. Cache the documentation providers.

logentry.author: zwabel
logentry.msg: Limit the maximum followed inheritance depth during search to 20, to prevent a crash due to endless recursion in endless inheritance chains BUG: 193114

logentry.author: apol
logentry.msg: Use filtered completion because otherwise it's too slow when using QtHelp (I wonder why, since in QComboBox it worked like a charm). Properly delete the documentationWidgets.

logentry.author: apol
logentry.msg: Changed the search view from QComboBox to QLineEdit+QCompleter. Fixes crashes and doesn't add weird stuff to the model.

logentry.author: apol
logentry.msg: Don't crash when there's no documentation plugin loaded

logentry.author: mwolff
logentry.msg: remove obsolete connection

logentry.author: mwolff
logentry.msg: make it possible to set the position of the code completion context in unit tests

logentry.author: mwolff
logentry.msg: make makeLink virtual so we can intersect it esp. for scripting languages where linking to internal function files makes no sense

logentry.author: mfuchs
logentry.msg: The savedialog has a save-icon and shows the items checked by default.

logentry.author: apol
logentry.msg: Remove wrong include.

logentry.author: apol
logentry.msg: Makes it possible to provide an index for each documentation provider. It also adds the needed interface to the documentationview so that we can take advantage of it.

logentry.author: nsams
logentry.msg: install file so it can be used by other plugins

logentry.author: nsams
logentry.msg:
Don't return launcher that is invalid for the current type. Invalid Launches can be configured when the type is changed.
Please review. CCMAIL: apaku@gmx.de

logentry.author: nsams
logentry.msg: Reload avaliable launch modes when launch type is changed

logentry.author: nsams
logentry.msg: Don't call parent implementation for KComboBox, data would be overwritten again.

logentry.author: nsams
logentry.msg: Move ProjectItemLineEdit into util so it can be used by multiple plugins.

logentry.author: apol
logentry.msg: Show the title of the current documentation.

logentry.author: scripty
logentry.msg: SVN_SILENT made messages (.desktop file)

logentry.author: mwolff
logentry.msg: remove obsolete connection, neither slot nor signal exist anymore

logentry.author: mwolff
logentry.msg: make the richtext better translatable

logentry.author: mattr
logentry.msg:
Rename the checkouted signal to checkedOut
Nobody else uses this signal yet. The impact is minimal, and the weird name is gone. :)

logentry.author: scripty
logentry.msg: SVN_SILENT made messages (.desktop file)

logentry.author: zwabel
logentry.msg: Show a navigation-widget when hovering problems from the problem reporter. It contains the information, and if the problem has a solution assistant, offers the different solutions through a menu.

logentry.author: zwabel
logentry.msg: Don't crash if the type attached to a FunctionDeclaration is not a FunctionType. This can happen with "typedef " functions BUG: 207452

logentry.author: mwolff
logentry.msg: when hitting ESC jump to the end of the last range. additionally add an (emtpy) range to the end of each snippet when there are other markers. this way we can easily accept the 'suggested' snippet and continue typing at the end of the snippet

logentry.author: mwolff
logentry.msg: fix loading of snippets with meta-data and newline handling

logentry.author: mwolff
logentry.msg: make subrepos actually usable by supplying their items during code completion as well

logentry.author: mwolff
logentry.msg: remove all snippets + subrepos when deleting a repo, rmDir does not delete non-empty dirs

logentry.author: mwolff
logentry.msg: refactor SnippetRepository: don't keep lists of pointers around, thats a) doubled b) leads often to crashes since we must keep track when what gets deleted. also fix the dtor: we must not call parent()->removeRow(row()) since that would again try to delete and hence crash

logentry.author: mwolff
logentry.msg: add some debug output, since I'm not sure this whole deleting-files business is rock-solid yet.

logentry.author: mwolff
logentry.msg: fix warning, properly add parens

logentry.author: mwolff
logentry.msg: don't try to create repos with empty path

logentry.author: apaku
logentry.msg: Now that the snippet plugin got some love and becomes rather useful, lets have it in the code area by default. BUG:192939

logentry.author: apaku
logentry.msg: Hmm, expecting a non-existing directory wasn't such a good idea, svn doesn't fail, so we shouldn't do so either.

logentry.author: apaku
logentry.msg: Fix the checkout job, only allow to checkout into a non-existing destination directory and use QFileInfo::canonicalFilePath only on the parent dir of the destination as the function returns an empty string for non-existing files.

logentry.author: apaku
logentry.msg: Fix initializeCVCS, it used the source location from the vcs plugin, which doesn't exist in the case of cvcs as the project is extracted into a tempdir.

logentry.author: apaku
logentry.msg: Use the source locations last part for the repository destination if the vcs plugin supports that. Makes the svn plugin import the new project foobar into <repository>/foobar instead of directly into the root.

logentry.author: apaku
logentry.msg: Make sure we only try to import existing directories, anything else might make us import the users $HOME or worse..

logentry.author: yurchor
logentry.msg: Typo fix

logentry.author: apaku
logentry.msg: ++compile

logentry.author: apaku
logentry.msg:
Revert "Allow a icvcs plugin to try to recover from import errors. This can be"
Not needed after all.

logentry.author: apaku
logentry.msg: New test validating that importing also works when directories in the remote path don't exist. svn auto-creates them.

logentry.author: apaku
logentry.msg: Fix the url normalization by also removing duplicate '/' inside the url path.

logentry.author: apaku
logentry.msg: Use proper dirName() and show that there's still a bug in the import job wrt. url normalization.

logentry.author: apaku
logentry.msg: Allow a icvcs plugin to try to recover from import errors. This can be used by svn to automatically create missing directories in the repository when importing a new project.

logentry.author: apaku
logentry.msg: A new test checking that importing into <repo>/<projectname> works properly (the basic test imports directly into <repo>/)

logentry.author: apaku
logentry.msg: Make sure the import metadata widget uses the source location for the destination (if he supports that) so svn imports are into <repo>/<projectname>

logentry.author: apaku
logentry.msg: Emit locationChanged() with the complete location, not just the destination-dir. Needed so the vcs-page gets the complete location as source. Hence also emit the signal when the project name changes.

logentry.author: apaku
logentry.msg: Ooops, const setter doesn't make any sense, make it non-const.

logentry.author: apaku
logentry.msg: Allow to re-use part of the source location as import destination for svn. This will be used in the appwizard to make sure the user ends up with a directory in the svn repository thats named after his project.

logentry.author: apaku
logentry.msg: Properly fixup remote and local urls to be as svn wants them: Canonical, no duplicate or trailing "/".

logentry.author: apaku
logentry.msg: Some more refactoring to more easily create other tests. This shows that we're still not fixing up the urls properly in all cases.

logentry.author: apaku
logentry.msg: Refactor the test a bit so its easier to extend.

logentry.author: zwabel
logentry.msg: Delete the commit patch source directly after the commit is done, to prevent an empty widget from floating around after the action

logentry.author: zwabel
logentry.msg: Do not insert double newlines between filenames in the list

logentry.author: zwabel
logentry.msg: Use the patch-review area as replacement for the commit dialog The patch-review toolview contains a large text-edit for the commit message, a button to execute the commit, and checkboxes for selecting all files to commit, exactly equal to the contents of the commit dialog

logentry.author: zwabel
logentry.msg: Remove some massive debug output This commit was reviewed and committed using the upcoming patch-review commit integration :-)

logentry.author: mwolff
logentry.msg: the expanding widget is owned by the caller, thanks David, for pointing that out\!

logentry.author: mwolff
logentry.msg: keep indendation level when executing snippet completion items.

logentry.author: mwolff
logentry.msg: reuse snippet completion item when inserting a snippet from the snippet view. remove now-obsolete stuff.

logentry.author: mwolff
logentry.msg: update explanation text in snippet dialog reflecting last commit

logentry.author: mwolff
logentry.msg:
introduce a new way to input snippet variables: when the item gets completed, a SelectionJumper gets created that manages a list of smartranges for the variables. the first range is selected at the beginning. You can jump to the next/prev variable (and get its range selected) with ALT + Left and ALT + Right respectivly. Esc closes the SelectionJumper.
TODO: maybe it should be better visible that a selection jumper is still running. or delete the selection jumper when the user moves the cursor by hand. but that could lead to other issues.

logentry.author: mwolff
logentry.msg: show snippet contents in expandable widget

logentry.author: mwolff
logentry.msg: introduce a CompletionTreeItem based SnippetCompletionItem this breaks variable expansion in snippets when executing code completion, but I have better plans for that. also, it is CompletionTreeItem based so language plugins will eventually be able to leverage its functionality.

logentry.author: mwolff
logentry.msg: add short label explaining what snippet keywords are there for

logentry.author: mwolff
logentry.msg: make sure the user doesn't remove snippet repositories by accident, by showing him a warning message.

logentry.author: apol
logentry.msg: Added some icons to the interface.

logentry.author: vprus
logentry.msg: Introduce the notion of current frame.

logentry.author: apaku
logentry.msg: Add a unit-test for importing into a repository (also checks out, but that should also be covered separately).

logentry.author: apaku
logentry.msg: Fix checkout, we always want HEAD when checking out (until we support checking out specific revisions at least)

logentry.author: apaku
logentry.msg: svn doesn't like trailing slashes or double "//" in its files or urls, so make sure we're passing around a clean version. BUG:202335

logentry.author: apaku
logentry.msg: Fix running import's, got the expression wrong in the if. CCBUG:202335

logentry.author: apaku
logentry.msg: The kill variable needs its own mutex so we don't cause deadlocks.

logentry.author: apaku
logentry.msg: Fix the find-module using HINTS

logentry.author: apaku
logentry.msg: Revert the unload-change, the plugins already do this. Disable deletion of the factory, it crashes for some - yet unknown reasons in the svnimport test.

logentry.author: apaku
logentry.msg: Make all except the update job silent so they don't raise the toolview. For the update job its important to see wether any conflicts have appeared (once we have highlighting in the project treeview this is not needed so much anymore). For the other jobs the output is usually useless.

logentry.author: apaku
logentry.msg: Properly deregister and delete the toolview factory. Fixes a possible crash on close

logentry.author: vprus
logentry.msg:
Rename "active thread" to "current thread".
Basically, that's how the thing is called in GDB, so let's not create confusion by calling it something else.

logentry.author: vprus
logentry.msg:
Make thread switching work.
The primary goal of this patch is to make the "Watches" item in the variables view update when a different thread is selected by the user.
This also does lots of refactoring in update logic for frame and variables, switching it to use event as opposed to states. The reason is that change in current thread and frame does not result in any change of IDebugSession::state, and therefore we can't detect this.
CCBUG: 207167

logentry.author: yurchor
logentry.msg: Typo fix

logentry.author: mwolff
logentry.msg: fix the whole snippet repo removal stuff, that was totally broken since lists of pointers where kept that never got updated properly...

logentry.author: mwolff
logentry.msg: add short explanation to snippet dialog, mentioning the $variable$ syntax

logentry.author: mwolff
logentry.msg: only try to remove files or folders if they exist

logentry.author: mwolff
logentry.msg: show error messages to the user when a file operation fails. don't force the user to select an existing folder as project repository location, but instead create the dir if required. also show a little explanation text in the add-repo dialog

logentry.author: mwolff
logentry.msg: copy completion range before requesting interpreted string, as it creates a dialog that makes the completion list lose focus. that in turn deleted the range which would crash when we finally try to replace the text

logentry.author: mwolff
logentry.msg: when executing a snippet from completion, insert the interpreted snippet, not the plain text version

logentry.author: mwolff
logentry.msg:
handle all entries of a folder in one go, fixes the whole 'remove obsolete items' logic work again, since the premise 'entries()' gets only emitted once for each listed dir was totally wrong.
thanks to Radu Benea for this patch, once again\!

logentry.author: mwolff
logentry.msg:
Extend actions available from tab context menu, supply these new actions:
new file reload file split view left/right split view top/bottom
Also make the text document reload() method a signal so we can access it easily in this case.
BUG: 182804

logentry.author: zwabel
logentry.msg: Do the seeking between hunks based on smart-ranges instead of the diff-model. This makes the seeking keep work correctly after lines were inserted/removed.

logentry.author: mwolff
logentry.msg:
Add context menu to container tabbar with generic "close tab" and "close other tabs" actions.
I eventually want to add more features, like "split view" or "new tab". But the latter seems to be out of the scope of sublime as far as I can see. Hence I'll eventually have to refactor this code so sublime implementers (like kdevelop shell) can provide custom context menu actions.
Imo the two actions alone are far better than no context menu at all. I really wanted "close other tabs"...

logentry.author: mwolff
logentry.msg:
refactor parts of the genericmanager: - use a composite job and sub-jobs for sub-directories. this makes listing of symlinked dirs possible. additionally it does not traverse into filtered directories anymore, as the old KIO::listDirRecursive would do - finally utilize the semi-new createImportJob method which fixes integration into the project-parse job etc. renderes some hacks obsolete.
Many thanks to Radu Benea for this patch

logentry.author: apaku
logentry.msg:
Add another safety-net.
However child should _never_ return a null-pointer unless "funky things" are happening. For example two threads accessing the project model at the same time, one adding a folder and settings its rowcount and then adding the files individually. Another thread might ask this folder for a child that hasn't been added.
Hence adding a Q_ASSERT() so we can catch such cases in development builds, but don't force a crash onto our users.

logentry.author: mwolff
logentry.msg: check pointer before accessing it

logentry.author: scripty
logentry.msg: SVN_SILENT made messages (.desktop file)

logentry.author: apaku
logentry.msg: Also print out mainwindow info.

logentry.author: apaku
logentry.msg: Some more output to better identify the area-list thats being used.

logentry.author: apaku
logentry.msg: Add some debug output to check wether sublime really emits the viewAdded signal multiple times. See http://bugs.kde.org/show_bug.cgi?id=204383

logentry.author: apaku
logentry.msg: The kompare-integration breaks proper review of changes done to CMakeLists.txt when using createClass, so disable it for now.

logentry.author: vprus
logentry.msg: That was not meant to be pure.

logentry.author: vprus
logentry.msg: Introduce IFrameStackModel::actOnStop.

logentry.author: vprus
logentry.msg:
Always update the framestack model.
While saving one command on each stop might be good, it proves extremely hard to design a debugger if the current thread and frame is undefined unless the frame stack widget is visible.

logentry.author: vprus
logentry.msg: Mark no frame active on start, as opposed to 0th.

logentry.msg: Fix warnings about member initialization order.

logentry.author: apaku
logentry.msg: Properly shutdown all running processes when runcontroller is cleaned.

logentry.author: aclu
logentry.msg: spell

logentry.author: aclu
logentry.msg: In the libraries, use Q_SIGNALS: and Q_SLOTS: instead of signals: and slots: They are syntactically equivalent and should be used to avoid conflicts with boost signals, and with python's use of "slots" in its headers.

logentry.author: aclu
logentry.msg: use KDE/KClass in angle brackets

logentry.author: aclu
logentry.msg: use KDE/KClass in angle brackets

logentry.author: aclu
logentry.msg: use KDE/KClass in angle brackets

logentry.author: aclu
logentry.msg: Files that do not end with a newline character can cause problems

logentry.author: aclu
logentry.msg: Do not assign QString::null or QString() to a QString. Instead use the .clear() method

logentry.author: aclu
logentry.msg: Spell

logentry.msg: Files that do not end with a newline character can cause problems

logentry.msg: missing or improper include guard in header

logentry.author: aclu
logentry.msg: Files that do not end with a newline character can cause problems

logentry.author: aclu
logentry.msg: spelling

logentry.author: aclu
logentry.msg: use KDE/KClass in angle brackets. see http://techbase.kde.org/Policies/Library_Code_Policy#Getting_.23includes_right

logentry.author: zwabel
logentry.msg: Improve patch-review: - Never create multiple patch-review working sets - Add a "Finish Review" and for future an optional "Cancel Review" button. When "Finish Review" is pressed, all files in the review-area are deleted, the patch is removed from patch-review, and kdevelop switches back to the code area. - Remove some useless buttons - Make the "Show" button work nicer: It just does the same thing that happens when a patch-review is started: Open the diff and all related files in the review-area - Do not crash when the document-controller opens a modal dialog while starting review

logentry.author: danxuliu
logentry.msg: Fix testresult executable name, which fixes failing memory test (the executable wasn't found)

logentry.author: scripty
logentry.msg: SVN_SILENT made messages (.desktop file)

logentry.author: vprus
logentry.msg: Encapsulate varobj inside GdbVariable (platform part).

logentry.author: vprus
logentry.msg: Move varobj creation to GdbVariable.

logentry.author: zwabel
logentry.msg: Fix last commit

logentry.author: zwabel
logentry.msg: Don't crash if no model-list was created

logentry.author: zwabel
logentry.msg:
Move the responsibility of visualizing a patch into the patch-review plugin, and access it through a global interface: - Rename the 'test' area to 'review' area - Create global interfaces for putting custom dynamic patches into the patch-review plugin - Use that interface to pass VCS patches to the patch-review plugin directly When reviewing a patch: - Switch into the review area - Open the patch in one file, either through kompare integration, or as a simple ".patch" file with kate highlighting, for overview - Open and highlight all related documents within editor-views, and jump to the first changed position within each document
The kompare integration will need some more work, to find a good balance between the functionalities of patches highlighted right in the editor, and within kompare parts.

logentry.author: zwabel
logentry.msg: Add a zero declaration to the list if no declaration was found. The cpp new class dialog expects the declaration-list to equal its access-list, else it asserts. Still not perfect as the base specifier will not be added now if no declaration was found, but much better than asserting. I hate debugging such miserably tested code.. future refactorings should happen in a branch, and only be merged into trunk after proper testing.

logentry.author: zwabel
logentry.msg: - Add markers to working-sets whether they are persistent or not - Delete all non-persistent working sets that are not active within any area during shutdown - Mark working sets persistent if the user did any conscious action on the working-set ever (activating, deactivating, merging, etc.) This prevents the problem that unaware users may accidentally accumulate tons of useless working sets.

logentry.author: vprus
logentry.msg:
Introduce GDB-specific Variable subclass.
I was working on finishing pretty printing support, which requires handling 'here are some new children' as well as 'children were removed' notifications from GDB. Doing this inside variablecontroller proved nasty, as then I had to made most of TreeItem interface public. This commit introduces GdbVariable that in future will handle everything.
This patch does not change anything in behaviour, it is pure refactoring.

logentry.author: vprus
logentry.msg: Remove floatsam.

logentry.author: scripty
logentry.msg: SVN_SILENT made messages (.desktop file)

logentry.author: binner
logentry.msg: remove duplicate "with" in Comment

logentry.author: apaku
logentry.msg: Fix various warnings from MSVC. Patch by Yaron Hirsch CCMAIL:yhirsch@netvision.net.il

logentry.author: apaku
logentry.msg: fix initialization for this repository by making it static. Patch by Yaron Hirsch CCMAIL:yhirsch@netvision.net.il

logentry.author: apaku
logentry.msg: Properly set svn:eol-style to native.

logentry.author: apaku
logentry.msg: header-only template classes do not need an export macro. How often do I have to repeat this until people will learn it?

logentry.author: apaku
logentry.msg: forgot to commit this file.

logentry.author: apaku
logentry.msg: msvc doesn't like inline classes very much, so export it and also uninline it.

logentry.author: apaku
logentry.msg: Use the right variable name, interesting that this didn't broke on windows.

logentry.author: apaku
logentry.msg: use the proper KDE variable for enabling exceptions, -fexceptions is gcc-only.

logentry.author: apaku
logentry.msg: Remove all remainings of the library as they cause problems building the plugin on windows and there's no need for exported symbols or a separate CMakeLists.txt anymore.

logentry.author: apaku
logentry.msg: include interfacesexport.h so the export macro is actually defined properly. Extract the destructor to a .cpp file, msvc doesn't like classes with just headers when there's an implemented function in it.

logentry.author: scripty
logentry.msg: SVN_SILENT made messages (.desktop file)

logentry.author: mwolff
logentry.msg: move classwidget into its own set of .cpp/.h files cleanup some header includes

logentry.author: vprus
logentry.msg: When current debug session is deleted, inform everybody. Also, teach framestack widget that there might not be a current debug session.

logentry.author: apaku
logentry.msg:
Revert "Change KDE requirement for kompare."
I don't know what your intention was but KDE 4.1 is definetly wrong. Please be more careful when you do changes and double-check the diff before you commit.
CCMAIL:killerfox512@gmail.com

logentry.author: rzarazua
logentry.msg: Change KDE requirement for kompare.

logentry.author: mwolff
logentry.msg: return an invalid cursor when we have no view. returning a default cursor is not what we want. we already had a bug due to this at one time. better fix it now before another bug occurs

logentry.author: mwolff
logentry.msg: make textdocument more failsafe

logentry.author: vprus
logentry.msg: Fix compilation and crash on startup.

logentry.author: vprus
logentry.msg:
Fix connection to VariableCollection::updateAutoUpdate.
Using ICore::self()->debugController() inside VariableCollection ctor is not working, since it's called from DebugController's ctor, and naturally the debugController() returns null at this point.

logentry.author: vprus
logentry.msg: More forgotten changes :-(

logentry.author: vprus
logentry.msg:
Refactor stack frame getting.
The primary reason for this change is that with current GDB, it is no longer required to actively ask for the list of threads. Insteads, one can listen to the notifications that are emitted whenever a thread is created, or exited. The current interface, specifically IStackController::fetchThread, on the other hand, assumes active polling. It seems more reasonable to move all responsibility to FrameStackModel, so that debugger-specific children classes of it can either pull, or use notification, or other methods.
Also, FrameStackModel was associated with IDebugController. It makes more sense to associate it with a session, so that when we eventually support debugging two programs at the same time, each can have it's own thread.
So, this patch kills IStackController, moving responsibility to FrameStackModel. GDB is not yet switched to use notifications, this is a topic for the next patch.
